Package TableStructures

Class TableType

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractObjects.DataType
      • TableStructures.TableType

    public class TableType
extends DataType
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  TableType.StringParser
      This interface has two implementing classes, one parsing a single token, and one for parsing several tokens into a single DataObject.

      • infoString

        public java.lang.String infoString​()
        reconstructs the type declaration such that it can be parsed again.
        Returns:
        the type declaration in a form which can be parsed again.

      • defineType

        public static TableType defineType​(java.lang.String typeSpecification,
                                   Context context,
                                   java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        Defines a new TableType. Examples for a Table type declaration are:
        Table:exam(Concept:student,Float:mark)
        Parameters:
        typeSpecification - a type declaration
        context - the context for the data type
        errors - for appending error messages if it is an erraneous Table-declaration
        Returns:
        null or a TableType

      • getColumnIndex

        public java.lang.Integer getColumnIndex​(java.lang.String columnName)
        for a given column name it yields the column index.
        Parameters:
        columnName - a column name
        Returns:
        the corresponding index, or null if the name is unknown.

        maps an array of column names to the array of indices
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an array of indices, or null if there is an unknown column name.

        parses a string as a TableObject
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        context - not needed
        Returns:
        the TableObject, or null if it could not be parsed.

      • compileRowFilter

        public java.util.function.Predicate<DataObject[]> compileRowFilter​(java.lang.String code,
                                                                   java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method compiles code for boolean tests of row elements. Example: The table contains columns with names mark1 and mark2. The method can then be used to compile a string "return mark1 < mark2" into a Predicate<DataObject[]> whose code accesses the corresponding column entries of the given row and evaluates the boolean expression. The predicate can be used as a filter for a stream of rows.
        Parameters:
        code - a string with a code fragment that returns a boolean value.
        errors - for inserting messages about compilation errors
        Returns:
        a Predicate<DataObject[]> that can be applied to a row of the given table.

      • compileRowFunction

        public <T> java.util.function.Function<DataObject[],T> compileRowFunction​(java.lang.String code,
                                                                          java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method compiles application code for row elements. Example: The table contains columns with names mark1 and mark2. The method can then be used to compile a string "return (Float)(mark1 + mark2)" into a Function<DataObject[],Float> whose code accesses the corresponding column entries of the given row and evaluates the expression.
        Parameters:
        code - a string with a code fragment
        errors - for inserting messages about compilation errors
        Returns:
        a Function<DataObject[],T> that can be applied to a row of the given table.

      • parseFromStream

        public TableObject parseFromStream​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String[]> stream,
                                   Context context,
                                   java.lang.StringBuilder errors,
                                   TableType.StringParser... parsers)
        This method allows one to parse a stream of String-arrays into DataObject items and to put them into a TableObject The stream of String-arrays may, for example, come from a csv-file. Either a single token in a String-array is parsed into a DataObject item, or several tokens are mapped to a single DataObject item.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream of String-arrays
        context - the context where the objects reside
        errors - for insering parsing errors
        parsers - one parser for each column in the TableType. A "null" entry generates a default parser for the column type.
        Returns:
        the parsed TableObject.

      • makeParser

        public TableStructures.TableType.SingletonStringParser makeParser​(int index,
                                                                  java.lang.String columnName,
                                                                  java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method generates a parser for mapping a single token to a DataObject
        Parameters:
        index - the index in the original token array from where to extract the token
        columnName - the name of the column in the resulting table
        errors - for inserting parsing errors
        Returns:
        the parser

      • makeParser

        public TableStructures.TableType.SingletonStringParser makeParser​(java.lang.String columnName,
                                                                  java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method generates a parser for mapping a single token to a DataObject The token is extracted from exactly the same position as the column name in the resulting array.
        Parameters:
        columnName - the name of the column in the resulting table
        errors - for inserting parsing errors
        Returns:
        the parser

      • makeParser

        public TableStructures.TableType.MultipleStringParser makeParser​(int[] indices,
                                                                 java.lang.String columnName,
                                                                 java.lang.StringBuilder errors,
                                                                 java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String[],Context,DataObject> parser)
        This method generates a parser for mapping several tokens to a DataObject
        Parameters:
        indices - The list of indices for extracting the tokens
        columnName - the name of the column in the resulting table
        errors - for inserting parsing errors
        parser - a function for mapping the tokens to a DataObject.
        Returns:
        the parser
